title: "Impressive" hand written script and dingbat/ornament
content:
I’m looking to ID the the woodcut/dingbat ...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080105130425im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/design_id_4452.jpg)

The font was successfully identified ... thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080105130425im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/font_id_5441.gif)

 [‹ (x) "Most Common Sexual Barriers" condensed serif on book cover - Favrile (François) {Mike Y}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080105130425/http:/www.typophile.com/node/37126 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) "The Don" 70's/80's Plaza-style sans w/ swashes - Embrionic {Angel} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080105130425/http:/www.typophile.com/node/37166 "Go to next forum topic")
author: link

comments.content:
Edit: I found my first post ... the title was changed and I sailed right past it ... my apology.

Still looking to ID the design.

lk

Now that’s a scary thought ... to have my handwriting made into a font!!! :)

Your response is appreciated. Thanks for the links.

LinK

The problem is, even if you think you’ve seen it before (I think I’ve seen it), there are soooo many hand-fonts from soooo many sources on the internet now, that it is daunting to even think about looking for it.

Here’s a bunch:  
 [http://www.fontgarden.com/gallery/a.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080105130425/http:/www.fontgarden.com/gallery/a.html "http://www.fontgarden.com/gallery/a.html")

Here’s some more:  
 [http://www.kevinandamanda.com/scrapbook/fonts/fontsforpeas/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080105130425/http:/www.kevinandamanda.com/scrapbook/fonts/fontsforpeas/ "http://www.kevinandamanda.com/scrapbook/fonts/fontsforpeas/")

And that doesn’t even scratch the surface. It is almost a national pastime to have your handwriting made into a font. I even did it once at a **[website that does it automatically](http://web.archive.org/web/20080105130425/http:/www.fontifier.com/)**:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080105130425im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/fphand_3579.jpg)
You can locate your posts by clicking on your name here in this thread which takes you to your profile page. Then click “Track”.
